intro: Sedum versadense subsp. chontalense, commonly known as the Chontalense stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, enabling it to thrive in arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone substrates, often in mountainous regions. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or white, which bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
